answers.answer: Hi,At such a young age, it’s a bit unusual for you to have been diagnosed as BPH because this is an ailment which occurs with ageing and doesn’t normally occur at the age of 28 years. Majority of the patients present at the age of around 50 years. Hence, I’ll suggest you to consult another urologist and revisit the diagnosis. Other causes of frequent urination like diabetes mellitus also need to be ruled out. In fact, stones in the urinary tract are much more common in causing the increased frequency of urination compared to BPH. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care.

question: I am a 28 year old male, I have had problems with extreme frequent urination for many years, I recently went to the doctor and he said it was BPH, well that kind of scares me since he said it could develope into cancer someday, but another doctor told me it wont?, hummm odd, well I still cant figure out what it is but I have had the problem since I was a grade schooler , even wet the bed till the age of 13...not fun, anyone have any ideas?
title: pee
